main.name: Danielle Wisen
main.bio: Hello there! Coming from a background in English teaching and writing I am looking to establish myself as a detail-oriented developer. I am eager to contribute my expertise and develop new skills. If you are looking for someone who is open to new opportunities and excited to learn, please contact me!
main.contactmessage: If you are looking for someone who is open to new opportunities and excited to learn, please email me at daniellewwise@gmail.com

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.school: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
education.description: Attended the UNC Chapel Hill Full-Stack Coding Boot Camp. Through this certificate program I gained the ability and knowledge to build dynamic web applications. Skills Gained include: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Responsive Design, BootStrap, Handlebars, Cookies, Local Storage, React.js, Heroku, Git, MySQL, Sequelize, MongoDB, Node.js, Express, Security and Session Storage, User Authentication, MERN Stack, QA, and Semantic HTML.

work.title: Assistant Language Teacher
work.description: Served as a cultural ambassador between the United States and Japan. Co-led an educational workshop for teachers on different learning methods of students. Engaged in local international exchange activities.

projects.title: Employee Directory
projects.category: Employee Directory is a React application that allows users to display employee information and dynamically update the directory with data from a connected API or database.

projects.title: Work Scheduler
projects.category: This project utilizes Moment.js and local storage allowing users to save work tasks in their browser window.

projects.title: Food & Flick
projects.category: Collaborative project integrating the OMDb and Spoonacular APIs to create a responsive, single-page website that helps you choose a movie to watch and a meal to cook at home.
